question.text: The electrochemical cell shown below is a concentration cell. $\mathrm{M} \mid \mathrm{M}^{2+}$ (saturated solution of a sparingly soluble salt, $\left.\mathrm{MX}_{2}\right) \| \mathrm{M}^{2 \perp}\left(0.001 \mathrm{~mol} \mathrm{dm}^{-3}\right) \mid \mathrm{M}$. The emf of the cell depends on the difference in concentrations of $\mathrm{M}^{2+}$ ions at the two electrodes. The emf of the cell at $298 \mathrm{~K}$ is $0.059 \mathrm{~V}$. Question: The solubility product $\left(\mathrm{K}_{s p} ; \mathrm{mol}^{3} \mathrm{dm}^{-9}\right)$ of $\mathrm{MX}_{2}$ at $298 \mathrm{~K}$ based on the information available for the given concentration cell is (take $2.303 \times \mathrm{R} \times 298 / \mathrm{F}=0.059 \mathrm{~V}$ )

solution.text:
$M \mid M^{2+}$ (aq) $\| M^{2+}$ (aq) $\mid M$

$0.001 \mathrm{M}$

Anode : $\quad M \longrightarrow M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})+2 e^{-}$

Cathode : $M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})+2 e^{-} \longrightarrow M$

$M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})_{c} \rightleftharpoons M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})_{a}$

$\begin{array}{c}

E_{\text {cell }}=0-\frac{0.059}{2} \log \left\{\frac{M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})_{a}}{10^{-3}}\right\} \\

\Rightarrow 0.059=-\frac{0.059}{2} \log \left\{\frac{M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})_{a}}{10^{-3}}\right\} \\

-2=\log \left\{\frac{M^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})_{a}}{10^{-3}}\right\}

\end{array}$

$\Rightarrow \quad 10^{-2} \times 10^{-3}=\mathrm{M}^{2+}(\mathrm{aq})_{a}=$ solubility $=s$

$\quad M X_{2} \rightleftharpoons M^{2+}+2 X^{-}$

$K_{s p}=S .(2 S)^{2} \quad 2 S$

$\Rightarrow \quad K_{s p}=4 s^{3}=4 \times\left(10^{-5}\right)^{3}=4 \times 10^{-15}$
